item.description:
Per Gary's suggestion, how about a "sunset hike" up Mount Wachusett?

Thank you, Gary, for clarifying the distance. Our hike will be 3.5 miles.

Length: 3.5 miles (round-trip), est 1.5 hours hiking (but we'll sit there + enjoy the sunset)
Difficulty: Estimated beginner-to-moderate (haven't done this trail, but Mount Wachusett is fairly easy for a fit person; there is a steep section, though)
Meet time: 6:15pm
Hike time: 6:30pm

Hike Description (Thanks, Gary!):

I'm plannning on hiking up for sunset, around 6:30. Hiking up from the South gate, on Westminster Rd. just below the wind turbines.

Hike up to the wind turbines then take the stagecoach trail to the Harrington to the summit. Maybe an hour hike up. Sunsets from the summit are excellent. Stay till the color runs out of the sky then walk the road back down to parking area. Maybe a 40 minute hike down.

FYI, I am personally not familiar with this trail, but other members of this group have done it; it's rather well-known.

About the Midstate Trail: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massachusetts_Midstate_Trail

What to bring:

  • Headlamp or flashlight (thanks Gary, I forgot to list it)
  • Water and maybe a snack
  • Camera recommended
  • No idea if there might be icy patches in shady spots; recommend non-skid shoes
  • Raincoat, just in case (rain shouldn't start until Saturday, though)
  • "Deep-woods"-type repellant, or with pemethrin (ticks flourishing due to mild winter)

Â
item.how_to_find_us: I drive a small white Dodge Stratus.

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Sunset Hike: Stage Coach Trail @ Mt Wachusett (meet @ 6:15, hike @ 6:30)
